17  KESSInelasticBetheFano::KESSInelasticBetheFano() :
18  fBetheFanoDepositedEnergy( 0. ),
19  fRho( 2.33e-24 )
20  {
21  fInteraction = string( "Inelastic" );
22  ReadMFP( "BetheFano_MFP.txt", fInElScMFPMap );
23  ReadPDF( "BetheFano.txt", fInElScMap );
24  }

26  KESSInelasticBetheFano::KESSInelasticBetheFano( const KESSInelasticBetheFano &aCopy ):
27  KSComponent(),
28  fBetheFanoDepositedEnergy( aCopy.fBetheFanoDepositedEnergy ),
29  fInElScMFPMap( aCopy.fInElScMFPMap ),
30  fInElScMap( aCopy.fInElScMap ),
31  fRho( aCopy.fRho )
32  {
33  }

44  void KESSInelasticBetheFano::CalculateCrossSection( const KSParticle& aParticle, double& aCrossSection )
45  {
46  double tKineticEnergy = aParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
47 
48  //map iterator to the maps above and below electronEnergy_eV
49  std::map< double, double >::iterator mapAbove, mapBelow;
50 
51  //find dictionary entry - mapAbove is the energy area ABOVE electronEnergy_eV
52  mapAbove = fInElScMFPMap.lower_bound( tKineticEnergy );
53 
54  //mapBelow the energy area BELOW electronEnergy_eV
55  mapBelow = mapAbove;
56  mapBelow--;
57 
58  double inElMFP1 = mapBelow->second;
59  double inElMFP2 = mapAbove->second;
60 
61  double inElENE1 = mapBelow->first;
62  double inElENE2 = mapAbove->first;
63 
64  double help = this->InterpolateLinear( tKineticEnergy, inElENE1, inElENE2, inElMFP1, inElMFP2 );
65 
66  //for BetheFano it is not the MeanFreePath that is stored, but a crossection-like variable
67  double MeanFreePathAngstroem = KConst::M_Si() / (KConst::N_A() * fRho * help);
68 
69  //aCrossSection = 12.06 * 1E-6 / (MeanFreePathAngstroem * 1E-10 * KConst::N_A());
70  aCrossSection = 12.06 / (MeanFreePathAngstroem * 1E-4 * KConst::N_A());
71  }
72 
73  void KESSInelasticBetheFano::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& aQueue )
74  {
75  //reset deposited energy counter.
76  fBetheFanoDepositedEnergy = 0.;
77 
78  double tKineticEnergy_eV = anInitialParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
79  intmsg_debug( "KESSInelasticBetheFano::Execute" << ret
80  << "Kinetic energy of particle: " << tKineticEnergy_eV << eom );
81 
82  //computes the energy loss due to scattering
83  double tEloss_eV = CalculateEnergyLoss( tKineticEnergy_eV );
84  intmsg_debug( "KESSInelasticBetheFano::Execute" << ret
85  << "Inelastic Calculator computed ELoss = " << tEloss_eV << eom );
86 
87  //computes the new angle due to scattering
88  double tTheta = CalculateScatteringAngle( tEloss_eV, tKineticEnergy_eV );
89  intmsg_debug( "KESSInelasticBetheFano::Execute" << ret
90  << "Inelastic Calculator computed Azimutal Scattering Angle Theta = "
91  << 180*tTheta/KConst::Pi() << eom );
92 
93  //dice an azimuthal angle
94  double tPhi = 2. * KConst::Pi() * KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
95  intmsg_debug( "KESSInelasticBetheFano::Execute" << ret
96  << "Randomly chosen azimuthal angle: " << 180*tPhi/KConst::Pi() << eom );
97 
98  //check if the new energy is too low
99  if( tKineticEnergy_eV - tEloss_eV < KConst::Q() * 0.1 )
100  {
101  tKineticEnergy_eV = tEloss_eV + KConst::Q() * 0.1;
102 
103  intmsg_debug( "KESSInelasticBetheFano::Execute" << ret
104  << "Warning: Energy after elastic scattering too low. Energy artificially increased. "<<eom );
105  }
106 
107  //update the final particle
108  KThreeVector tInitialDirection = anInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
109  KThreeVector tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
110  KThreeVector tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
111  KThreeVector tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
112 
113  aFinalParticle = anInitialParticle;
114  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
115  aFinalParticle.SetKineticEnergy_eV( tKineticEnergy_eV - tEloss_eV );
116  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
117 
118  fStepEnergyLoss = tEloss_eV;
119  fStepNInteractions = 1;
120 
121  unsigned int IonisedShell = 0;
122  if( fIonisationCalculator )
123  {
125  IonisedShell = fIonisationCalculator->IonizeShell( tEloss_eV, aFinalParticle, aQueue );
126  }
127  else
128  {
129  //deposit energy locally
130  fBetheFanoDepositedEnergy = tEloss_eV;
131  }
132 
133  if( fRelaxationCalculator )
134  {
135  //doublecheck ionization has happened
136  if( fIonisationCalculator )
137  {
138  if( IonisedShell != 3 )
139  {
141  fRelaxationCalculator->RelaxAtom( IonisedShell, aFinalParticle, aQueue );
142  }
143  }
144  else
145  {
146  intmsg( eError ) << "KESSInelasticBetheFano::Execute" << ret << "Trying to do AugerCascade without DeltaRay Production (Ionisation)" << eom;
147  }
148  }
149  else
150  {
151  //deposit energy locally
152  if( fIonisationCalculator )
153  {
154  if( IonisedShell != 3 )
155  {
156  fBetheFanoDepositedEnergy += fIonisationCalculator->GetBindingEnergy( IonisedShell );
157  }
158  }
159  }
160 
161  }
162 
163  double KESSInelasticBetheFano::CalculateEnergyLoss( const double& EKin )
164  {
165  if( EKin > 107.0 && EKin < 409000.0 )
166  {
167  double energyLoss = 0.;
168  double resultAbove = 0.;
169  double rand3 = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
170 
171  //map iterator to the maps above and below the kinetic energy of the electron
172  std::map< double, std::vector< std::vector< double > > >::iterator mapAbove, mapBelow;
173 
174  //vector iterator for integral (probability)
175  std::vector< double >::iterator intBelow, intAbove;
176 
177  //value (energy loss)
178  double valBelow, valAbove;
179 
180  //find dictionary entry - mapAbove is the energy area ABOVE kinetic energy of the electron
181  mapAbove = fInElScMap.lower_bound( EKin );
182 
183  //mapBelow the energy area BELOW kinetic energy of the electron
184  mapBelow = mapAbove;
185  mapBelow--;
186 
187  //search for the values above and below the probability integral
188  intAbove = mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).end();
189  intBelow = mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).begin();
190 
191  //the integral doesn't start at 0 all the time. get new random number if no value is found
192  while( rand3 <= *intBelow )
193  {
194  rand3 = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
195  }
196 
197  intAbove = lower_bound( intBelow, intAbove, rand3 );
198 
199  intBelow = intAbove;
200  intBelow--;
201 
202  //fill the variables with the according energy losses
203  valAbove = mapAbove->second.at( 0 ).at( intAbove - mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
204  valBelow = mapAbove->second.at( 0 ).at( intBelow - mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
205 
206  //interpolate to actual random number and save
207  resultAbove = this->InterpolateLinear( rand3, *intBelow, *intAbove, valBelow, valAbove );
208 
209  //see above (but now for the lower energy area)
210  intAbove = mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).end();
211  intBelow = mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).begin();
212 
213  intAbove = lower_bound( intBelow, intAbove, rand3 );
214 
215  intBelow = intAbove;
216  intBelow--;
217 
218  valAbove = mapBelow->second.at( 0 ).at( intAbove - mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
219  valBelow = mapBelow->second.at( 0 ).at( intBelow - mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
220 
221  double resultBelow = this->InterpolateLinear( rand3, *intBelow, *intAbove, valBelow, valAbove );
222 
223  //interpolate between the results for energy areas above and below the kinetic energy of the electron
224  energyLoss = this->InterpolateLinear( EKin, mapBelow->first, mapAbove->first, resultBelow, resultAbove );
225 
226  return energyLoss;
227  }
228  else
229  {
230  intmsg( eError ) << "Energy of particle out of range for PDF/MFP tables." << " Please check your Terminators to ensure that the particle energy" << " is always between 107 < E < 409,000 eV when using BetheFano!" << eom;
231  return 0.0;
232  }
233 
234  }
235 
236  double KESSInelasticBetheFano::CalculateScatteringAngle( const double& EnergyLoss, const double& KineticEnergy )
237  {
238  return std::asin( std::sqrt( EnergyLoss / KineticEnergy ) );
239  }
240
